pull.title: test: fix "bitcoind already running" warnings on macOS
pull.body:
On macOS, `pidof` installed via brew returns b'' rather than None.
Account for this, to remove spurious warnings from the test_runner.

verification.payload:
tree e10cbd8a0a19cb87fef1506e7d18dde9f1b38b61
parent b90dad5143993d266cdfeece898164d648bbbd78
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1573835907 -0500
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1573851827 -0500

test: fix bitcoind already running warnings on macOS

On macOS, pidof installed via brew returns b'' rather than None.
Account for this, to remove spurious warnings from the test_runner.

events.message:
test: fix bitcoind already running warnings on macOS

On macOS, pidof installed via brew returns b'' rather than None.
Account for this, to remove spurious warnings from the test_runner.

events.body:
Right, this was incorrect before, `subprocess.check_output` will never return None.

ACK 1c23ea5fe67b88fd72a1ff640dd1bbb21a34fbf4

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -364,9 +364,10 @@ def main():
 def run_tests(*, test_list, src_dir, build_dir, tmpdir, jobs=1, enable_coverage=False, args=None, combined_logs_len=0, failfast=False, runs_ci, use_term_control):
     args = args or []
 
-    # Warn if bitcoind is already running (unix only)
+    # Warn if bitcoind is already running
+    # On macOS pidof (installed via brew) returns b''
comments.body:
Is this a change that happened due to pidof change or due to a python change?

What does `pidof bitoind; echo $?` print?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -364,9 +364,10 @@ def main():
 def run_tests(*, test_list, src_dir, build_dir, tmpdir, jobs=1, enable_coverage=False, args=None, combined_logs_len=0, failfast=False, runs_ci, use_term_control):
     args = args or []
 
-    # Warn if bitcoind is already running (unix only)
+    # Warn if bitcoind is already running
+    # On macOS pidof (installed via brew) returns b''
comments.body:
> Is this a change that happened due to pidof change or due to a python change?

The `pidof` source used by brew hasn't changed since 2005, so I'd guess a Python change if anything.

> What does pidof bitoind; echo $? print?

```bash
pidof bitcoind; echo $?
65657 
0
```

+    # Warn if bitcoind is already running

comments.body:
```suggestion
    # pidof might fail or return an empty string if the process is not running
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -364,9 +364,10 @@ def main():
 def run_tests(*, test_list, src_dir, build_dir, tmpdir, jobs=1, enable_coverage=False, args=None, combined_logs_len=0, failfast=False, runs_ci, use_term_control):
     args = args or []
 
-    # Warn if bitcoind is already running (unix only)
+    # Warn if bitcoind is already running
+    # On macOS pidof (installed via brew) returns b''
     try:
-        if subprocess.check_output(["pidof", "bitcoind"]) is not None:
+        if subprocess.check_output(["pidof", "bitcoind"]) not in [None, b'']:
comments.body: I think the `None` can be removed. `check_output` should either fail or return an (empty) string.
